thread.title: Teen in custody in attempted carjacking that led to fatal shooting, St. Louis police say
thread.title_full: Teen in custody in attempted carjacking that led to fatal shooting, St. Louis police say

author: From staff reports
title: Teen in custody in attempted carjacking that led to fatal shooting, St. Louis police say
text:
Close J.B. Forbes • jforbes@post-dispatch.com 
A candlelight vigil was held on Sunday, Feb. 12, 2017, at the corner of Juniata Street and Gustine Avenue for a man who was shot and killed on Juniata on Friday. Almost 100 people, mostly from the neighborhood, met and then marched up and down Juniata Street past the spot where the killing took place. Photo by J.B. Forbes, featured Teen in custody in attempted carjacking that led to fatal shooting, St. Louis police say From staff reports ( … ) J.B. Forbes • jforbes@post-dispatch.com 
A candlelight vigil was held on Sunday, Feb. 12, 2017, at the corner of Juniata Street and Gustine Avenue for a man who was shot and killed on Juniata on Friday. Almost 100 people, mostly from the neighborhood, met and then marched up and down Juniata Street past the spot where the killing took place. Photo by J.B. Forbes, jforbes@post-dispatch.com 
ST. LOUIS • A 16-year-old boy is in custody in the fatal shooting of a 72-year-old visitor to St. Louis during a carjacking attempt last week, police said Wednesday. 
The shooting happened Friday in the 3800 block of Juniata Street. 
The teen is being held as a juvenile on charges of second-degree murder, robbery and armed criminal action, police said. He was arrested on Sunday in connection to an armed robbery that occurred in the 3200 block of Samuel Shepard Drive earlier on the same night as the fatal shooting on Juniata. 
During that robbery, a 2009 Hyundai Sonata was taken. Further investigation revealed the stolen vehicle was connected to the homicide on Juniata, police said. 
Investigators are still searching for a second suspect. 
Police on Monday identified the victim in the shooting on Juniata as Kenneth Spalter, 72, of Pound Ridge, N.Y., a small town in Westchester County near New York City. 
Police said two men approached Spalter and a woman, 71, as they were getting out of a car and demanded their keys and car. Spalter struggled with the suspects, and one of robbers shot Spalter once, killing him.
